maqras.text: I call to witness this city
And you are free in this city
As are the parent and child
Indeed We have created the human being into toil and struggle
Do they think that none has power over them
They may say, “Wealth have I accumulated in abundance
Does he think that no one sees him
Have We not made for him a pair of eyes
And a tongue, and a pair of lips
And shown him the two highways
But he has made no rush to the path that is steep
And what will explain to you the path that is steep
It is freeing the captive
Or giving food in a day of hunger
To the orphan who claims relationship
Or to the indigent down in the dust
Then will he be of those who believe, and encourage patience, and encourage deeds of kindness and compassion
These are the companions of the right hand
But those who reject Our signs, they are the companions of the left hand
On them will be fire vaulted all around
By the sun and its splendor
By the moon as it follows it
By the day as it shows its glory
By the night as it conceals it
By the firmament and its structure
By the earth and its expanse
By the soul, and the proportion and order given to it
And its enlightenment as to its difficulty and its consciousness
Certainly she succeeds who purifies it
And she fail who corrupts it
The Thamud rejected through their inordinate wrongdoing
Behold, their representative was the most terrible person among them
But the messenger of God said to them, “It is a she-camel of God, so let it have a drink.”
Then they rejected him, and they hamstrung it. So their Lord, on account of their crime, obliterated their traces and leveled them
And for Him is no fear of its consequences
By the night as it conceals
By the day as it appears in glory
By the creation of male and female
Indeed, what you strive for is diverse
So he who gives and is conscious of God
And testifies to the best
We will indeed make smooth for him the path to bliss
But he who suffers from greed and thinks himself self-sufficient
And denies the best
We will indeed make smooth for him the path to misery
Nor will his wealth profit him when he falls headlong
Indeed We take upon Ourselves to guide
And indeed to Us belong the end and the beginning
Therefore I warn you of a fire blazing fiercely
None will reach it but the most unfortunate ones
Who give the lie to truth and turn their backs
But those most devote will be removed far from it
Those who give their wealth for self-purification
And have in their minds no favor from anyone, for which a reward is expected in return
But only the desire to seek for the Countenance of their Lord Most High
And soon will they attain satisfaction
By the glorious morning light
And by the night when it is still
Your Lord has not abandoned you, nor is He displeased
And indeed the future will be better for you than the present
And soon your Lord will give you that with which you will be well pleased
Did He not find you an orphan and give you shelter
And He found you wandering, and He gave you guidance
And He found you in need, and made you independent
Therefore, treat not the orphan with harshness
Nor refuse the petitioner
But the bounty of your Lord, proclaim
